newsitem.title: USA: Soap opera actress goes 0 for 17 in U.S. TV awards.
newsitem.headline: Soap opera actress goes 0 for 17 in U.S. TV awards.

text.p: Susan Lucci, who plays Erica in the soap opera "All My Children," failed to win a Daytime Emmy as outstanding lead actress in a dramatic series Wednesday after being nominated for the 17th time.
The award went instead to Jess Walton, Jill in "The Young and the Restless."
Justin Deas -- Buzz in "The Guiding Light" -- was named best lead actor.
"General Hospital" received a Daytime Emmy as best dramatic series.
Perennial favourite "The Oprah Winfrey Show" topped the talk show category. Rosie O'Donnell was honoured as best talk show host.
Fred Rogers of "Mr. Rogers' Neighbourhood" received a lifetime achievement award.
The 24th annual Daytime Emmy awards were broadcast live from Radio City Musical Hall, with Lucci and Regis Philbin, of "Live With Regis and Kathie Lee," as co-hosts.
